title: Sir Anish Mikhail Kapoor
summary: Sir Anish Mikhail Kapoor is a prominent British-Indian sculptor, born in Mumbai in 1954. He specializes in installation art and conceptual art, having trained at Hornsey College of Art and Chelsea School of Art and Design in the UK. His distinguished public sculptures include Chicago's "Cloud Gate" ("The Bean"), "Sky Mirror," "Temenos," "Leviathan," and London's "ArcelorMittal Orbit." Kapoor has received numerous accolades, such as the Turner Prize (1991), a knighthood (2013), and the Genesis Prize (2017) for his artistic impact and advocacy for refugees. He also designed the 2018 Brit Awards statuette and was featured in the British passport.
key_points: British-Indian sculptor specializing in installation and conceptual art.
Creator of iconic public sculptures, including "Cloud Gate" in Chicago and "ArcelorMittal Orbit" in London.

timeline: 1990: Awarded the Premio Duemila Prize at the 44th Venice Biennale.
2006: "Cloud Gate" unveiled in Chicago; "Sky Mirror" exhibited at Rockefeller Center, New York City.
2010: "Sky Mirror" exhibited in Kensington Gardens, London.
2011: "Leviathan" exhibited at the Grand Palais in Paris.
2012: "ArcelorMittal Orbit" completed for London's Olympic Park; received the Padma Bhushan from the Indian government.
2013: Received a knighthood for services to visual arts.
2014: Awarded an honorary doctorate degree from the University of Oxford.
2015: An image of Kapoor featured in the British passport.
2016: Announced as a recipient of the LennonOno Grant for Peace.
2017: Received the Genesis Prize; designed the statuette for the 2018 Brit Awards.

current_status: Sir Anish Kapoor is currently a highly influential and innovative artist of his generation, widely recognized for his significant contributions to visual arts and his ongoing advocacy for refugees and displaced people. He continues to receive major international accolades.
future_prospects: Based on his established career and recent accolades, future prospects for Sir Anish Kapoor likely include the creation of new monumental public art commissions, continued participation in major international exhibitions, and further exploration of his conceptual and installation art practice. His ongoing advocacy for social causes suggests continued engagement beyond purely artistic pursuits.
